title: If it takes 10 hours for 5 painters to paint 500 m^2 of a wall, how many painters does it take to paint 600 m^2 of a wall in 8 hours? - Quora

response.answer_text: Using the first part of the question, we can calculate the hourly labor of one single painter, assuming every painter paints at the same rate. The equation would be 10•5•x=500 with x being the square meters of wall a single painter can paint in one hour. By dividing on both sides we get that x=10. Now, using the result from the above equation, we can set up a similar calculation but this time we are looking for the number of painters it will take. 8•10•n=600, with n being the amount of painters. By again dividing on both sides we get that it will take 7,5 painters.
